New Records: Ross Adair scored Ireland's third century in T20Is
Ireland's first T20I win against South Africa
Key Match Events: Mark Adair took 4 for 31 to seal the win
Reeza Hendricks scored his second successive half-century
Matthew Breetzke scored his first half-century
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland beat South Africa for the first time in a T20I
Ireland became the first team to win a match batting first at the Zayed Cricket Stadium in the last eight T20Is at the venue
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was Ireland's first T20I win against South Africa and second overall against them in internationals
Others: Lungi Ngidi, who has been excellent on the tour, started the squeeze with an over of slower balls
Left-arm spinner Matthew Humphreys turned 22 on Saturday and celebrated with a trip to the Abu Dhabi Louvre but the real gift came 24 hours later when he took his first wicket of the series
